1.text: Paul, an apostle, not of men, neither by man, but by Jesus Christ, and God the Father, who raised him from the dead,

2.text: And all the brethren who are with me, to the churches of Galatia.

3.text: Grace be to you, and peace from God the Father, and from our Lord Jesus Christ,

4.text: Who gave himself for our sins, that he might deliver us from this present wicked world, according to the will of God and our Father:

5.text: To whom is glory for ever and ever. Amen.

6.text: I wonder that you are so soon removed from him that called you into the grace of Christ, unto another gospel.

7.text: Which is not another, only there are some that trouble you, and would pervert the gospel of Christ.

8.text: But though we, or an angel from heaven, preach a gospel to you besides that which we have preached to you, let him be anathema.

9.text: As we said before, so now I say again: If any one preach to you a gospel, besides that which you have received, let him be anathema.

10.text: For do I now persuade men, or God? Or do I seek to please men? If I yet pleased men, I should not be the servant of Christ.

11.text: For I give you to understand, brethren, that the gospel which was preached by me is not according to man.

12.text: For neither did I receive it of man, nor did I learn it; but by the revelation of Jesus Christ.

13.text: For you have heard of my conversation in time past in the Jews’ religion: how that, beyond measure, I persecuted the church of God, and wasted it.

14.text: And I made progress in the Jews’ religion above many of my equals in my own nation, being more abundantly zealous for the traditions of my fathers.

15.text: But when it pleased him, who separated me from my mother’s womb, and called me by his grace,

16.text: To reveal his Son in me, that I might preach him among the Gentiles, immediately I condescended not to flesh and blood.

17.text: Neither went I to Jerusalem, to the apostles who were before me: but I went into Arabia, and again I returned to Damascus.

18.text: Then, after three years, I went to Jerusalem, to see Peter, and I tarried with him fifteen days.

19.text: But other of the apostles I saw none, saving James the brother of the Lord.

20.text: Now the things which I write to you, behold, before God, I lie not.

21.text: Afterwards I came into the regions of Syria and Cilicia.

22.text: And I was unknown by face to the churches of Judea, which were in Christ:

23.text: But they had heard only: He, who persecuted us in times past, doth now preach the faith which once he impugned:

24.text: And they glorified God in me.
